definitions.definition: One of a number of parallel grooves and ridges in a rock or rocky deposit , formed by repeated twinning or cleaving of crystals .
One of a number of parallel scratch lines in rock outcrops , formed when glaciers dragged rocks across the landscape.
The action of marking with a stria .
The result of being marked with a stria .
a parallel series of small grooves , channels , or impressions typically within a metal roof panel used to help reduce the potential for oil-canning .

main_definition: ( countable , mineralogy ) One of a number of parallel grooves and ridges in a rock or rocky deposit , formed by repeated twinning or cleaving of crystals .
secondary_definitions: ( countable , geomorphology ) One of a number of parallel scratch lines in rock outcrops , formed when glaciers dragged rocks across the landscape.
The action of marking with a stria .
The result of being marked with a stria .
( roofing ) a parallel series of small grooves , channels , or impressions typically within a metal roof panel used to help reduce the potential for oil-canning .
